intro: Uraria cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf uraria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its seeds are encased in pods and are adapted for dispersal by wind or animals. The botanical features of Uraria cordata make it an important species in ecological and agricultural contexts.
